name: NPR
text: The state House and Senate both approved legislation to remove the 126-year-old current flag and to form a commission to redesign it. https://t.co/s1y58Vj4uc

name: NPR
text: Stefan Lynch was raised by gay parents in the early eighties. Even in the face of the terrible sickness and loss caused by AIDS, their community of "aunties" showed him how to survive and care for one another. @StoryCorps https://t.co/4WXygsFyEk

name: NPR
text: The actor and serial prankster Sacha Baron Cohen is suspected of infiltrating a far-right group's rally in Washington state over the weekend. https://t.co/tvMnAQKGNZ

name: NPR
text: Beyoncé's upcoming visual album, described as "a celebratory memoir for the world on the Black experience," will drop on Disney+ next month. https://t.co/0Bm9sKBuba

name: NPR
text: Hasan Minhaj, the host of "Patriot Act," spoke with NPR about his interview with Keith Ellison, the Minnesota attorney general who is prosecuting former police in the George Floyd case. https://t.co/Xv2j3dMwku

name: NPR
text:
Robert Caro found the farmers impacted by Robert Moses' deal to move a road to pass through farmland instead of a private golf course.

“I realized that if I really wanted to write about political power...I would have to write also about the powerless." 
 https://t.co/KAtTBwuuLf

name: NPR
text:
The VA's motto is from Lincoln's 2nd inaugural address: "...To care for him who shall have borne the battle and for his widow, and his orphan." 

In all of America's wars, it was never just "him" bearing the battle.

Some say the motto should reflect that. https://t.co/21T8o9Q5oZ

name: NPR
text:
"Policing is not a marketplace. You can't choose another police force to take care of you," Rep. Joaquin Castro says. 

"And too often, there has been systemic racism and brutality that both African American and Latino communities have had to deal with." https://t.co/Je8NOvQ2OZ

name: NPR
text:
ICYMI: Lawmakers in Mississippi voted on Sunday to remove the Confederate battle emblem from the state flag. The bill now goes to the governor, who has said he would sign it.
https://t.co/Go6BZMxjgg

name: NPR
text:
The number of confirmed coronavirus deaths surpassed half a million globally on Sunday.

And more than 10 million cases have been confirmed around the world — though researchers say the real number is likely much higher.
 https://t.co/3WiKXCS4ed
